item.title: Public Health and Safety Concern: Widespread Dog Fouling on Greenwich Pavements, 18th January
item.description:
The pavements in Greenwich have become increasingly inaccessible due to the sheer amount of dog fouling. Children are regularly slipping or falling into it, and bikes, shoes, and clothing are being smeared with dog waste. This is unhygienic, unsafe, and completely unacceptable in a public space used by families every day. Urgent action and proper enforcement are needed. It is a disgrace.
Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Pelton Road, Greenwich
Report on FixMyStreet
